comments.commentBody: Yeah, Benjamin Netanyahu...there's an avatar of peace to conjure with.
Most Americans were smart enough to see through the lies of AIPAC and netanyahu!

Amazing indeed that this person has an almost ironclad lock on her position. Yet conservatives around the country run around bemoaning how hard it is to remove a teacher with tenure. I taught for 30 years and never heard of any teacher anywhere being as "protected" as this misguided person is. How 'bout it, right wing? Do you agree that few in this world have the kind of job protection that Ms. Davis's position grants to her?

Well, I was just looking at the hair raising comments about the refugees in Hungary, and one of our fellow Americans stated that the Europeans needed to be careful about accepting them because we had an unassimilated group here that should have been returned to Africa. So, The irrationality factor is out there. I think those commenters will probably come here now to beat up on their fellow Americans, rather than the unfortunate Syrians. One commenter compared the situation to the Siege of Vienna, so I am trying to think of a comparison here. Maybe, the slave revolts, or the Dakota Uprising?

You can't finesse a mob action, mobs never stay on point.

If some intellectual leader like a King had invented, "blacklivesmatter" his stature & discipline might have held it coherently on target and in focus. Alas the movement has been a rowdy parade of ill defined and poorly disciplined, often rough & tumble protest, bordering on mayhem. Imagine if King's non-violent protest had not remained disciplined.

Specifically the continued inclusion of the Mike Browne case, where in a wild kid forces a cop to discharge a handgun inside his patrol vehicle, demonstrates the movement has no ability to distinguish between the highly varied quality of the actions of the Black men it purports to defend.

On top of this White supporters are guilty of being too lenient as they blindly kumbaya. The overall effect is mob tribal action, and opportunists like Fox take advantage rather than help to clarify.

This editorial challenges straw man effigies of the Republican candidates. I wouldn't vote for any of them, but I give them the credit of knowing their history. Their critique of the Black Lives Matter Movement is that it is causing the kind of destruction, division, and violence that is contrary to the peaceful, practical progress espoused by Dr. King and a few weeks ago in a YouTube video by Hillary Clinton. Black Lives Matter! They do! And to get the recognition and fair treatment they warrant as American citizens, they deserve advocates who are strategic and set on palpable policy goals, not the chaos of Baltimore and Ferguson, which Governor Haley is right in critiquing.

There were people caught on tape shouting "white power" at Donald Trump's Alabama rally last week. Is the entire republican party thus inflammatory? Is the entire republican party hateful because of those people? Does everyone there support the KKK?

You're right, facts shouldn't be ignored. Yet you've chosen to ignore that there's always idiots in any large enough group, because context would have forced you to state your actual feelings without going through logical contortions, and that explanation surely wouldn't have sounded as polite.

Let's not choose to ignore the recent march in Minneapolis where Black Lives Matters members chanted "Pigs in a blanket fry'em like bacon".
This language is inflammatory and hateful.
Sorry but your premise that Black Lives Matter is not inflammatory is false.
Facts should not be ignored even in opinion columns.

We're talking about LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIALS who are supposed to uphold the law and apply it fairly and NOT target blacks because they're black and then create situations whereby they can shoot them in the back as they run away.  Those events should make you just as upset as if you were black because no one, white or black, should want to live in a country where we tolerate such clear abuses of the law BY law enforcement officials.

You are correct. It's not about black-on-black violence. The criminal justice system has no problem holding blacks accountable for crimes they commit. White cops, on the other hand, seem to enjoy special treatment. That's why BLM focuses on blacks killed by white cops.
To me. "Black Lives Matter" is only interested in blacks, especially "unarmed" black men killed by white police officers.  What about the blacks killed by other blacks?

I could say to Huckabee that he should read King's speech delivered at the Riverside Church in NYC where he recognized the cruel irony of sending young black men to Viet Nam to fight and die for the same rights they were denied back home. (Of course that war was never about bringing freedom to the Vietnamese, but that's another story.). Yes, I could make that suggestion to Huckabee, but even if he did read that speech, he is fundamentally incapable of understanding it.

The unfortunate political dynamics of race in America have not changed over two centuries except that it is now Democrats who champion civil rights instead of the Party of Lincoln and its race-coded dominance in the South.  It's a sad commentary on the crass political tactics that seek to appeal to the worst human instincts of fear, other blame, and the bigotry of racism.  Fortunately, what is changing are the population demographics that led to the election of our first African-American President and favor an increasing acceptance of people of color.  Perhaps, we are witnessing in the Black Lives Matter movement the final battle over white racism and the aging white male population that supports it and are now rallying under the Trump banner.  As an aging white male, I hope it is so.
Do Black people get a vote as to whether they think Bernie Sanders is completely aware of their problems?  Or must they acquiesce to the reality of your perception?

I agree with the goals and message of Black Lives Matter.  However, the message of Bernie Sanders who was vilified for emphasizing the economics of poverty and was assumed because of this to not honor blacks was uncalled for.  The economics of power which affects all races is not an exclusive issue and only adds to the subject of race in our country.  Bernie Sanders seems completely aware of the problems of blacks in this country and supportive of the problems of race which have haunted us.
Convenient that you cite Hoover without mentioning his bosses who were also complicit: JFK, RFK and LBJ. Foul principles, and principals.
I read your article in the wash  post Sally.  Well said again!
Jack, how true, thank you for a brief and accurate comment.

Goodell is in charge of an organization with a license to print money, is paid $44M per year and doesn't get it!  The public image of the NFL may have never been lower. It apparently couldn't care less about the players' well-being, barely cares about their illegal activities and only when he senses a loss of power and "image" does he react as any bully does, and reveals a complete lack of integrity and respect for legal process. It barely matters at this point about the details of "deflate gate", Goodell is ill-equipped to lead anything and should just go. It's a violent sport of modern day gladiators and Goodell believes the thumb of the Emperor should decide all fates.
right? theyre focusing on skin color to keep the attention away from Gun Control. 3cheers for NRA sponsering.

I agree that it doesn't make sense to take a comment like that personally.  That would be narcissistic.  However, I think the person who would make that assertion is insecure.  Why would anyone need to say that he or she or the group to which he or she belongs is beautiful, unless that person was insecure?
What is your source for that? No branch of this group has called for violence against the police.

Just Thinking - you hit on something that I was thinking about as I was reading all the posts. How do we reconcile that, in the South at least, the majority of prisoners are black? Are all these men and women innocent? I doubt it. They committed crimes, they got caught, convicted and are now in prison. Surely that's reasonable.

But then I look at the statistics about whites who commit the same or similar crimes and they get weaker sentences, often times probation or fines while their black counterparts go to prison. And that, my friend, is a big problem.

This article is a pathetic attempt to scapegoat the real problem.

Pick up any daily paper in America and look at the headlines. They reveal a painful truth. Black men are the nexus of most violence and crime in their neighborhoods. Residents live in fear of their peers.

A BLM movement is needed that rejects crime and violence, fights for a renewal of family structure, reveres education, nurtures children.

You should be.
I've never heard such nonsense.
Equating BLM to the Civil Rights leaders of the 1960s is like comparing Kim Kardashian to Aristotle.

Another poorly constructed opinion piece by an out of touch and backwards looking editorial board. BLM is a virulently anti-police movement that ignores reality and scapegoats law enforcement instead of the real threat to inner city citizens; contemporary black culture itself and endemic black on black violence.

Because it is based on liberal myths and distortions, it will soon thankfully burn out and disappear just like Occupy Wall Street.

It seems that Blacks just are not very grateful, for the wonderful kindness and education opportunities they received in our southern states (sarcasim intentional).  I was born on the Canadian border, and my first encounter with Dixie occurred when I was stationed at military bases in the deep segregated south, in Georgia and Alabama in the late 50s and early 60s.  I was appalled at how Blacks were treated as subhuman untermensch. I found it astonishing and ghastly that southern whites considered themselves to be ultra Christians.  Their version of Jesus was the polar opposite of mine.  But then, they seemed to prefer the slaying and stoning featured mostly in the Old Testament.

As usual, black people and their liberal, white allies, are their own worst enemies in the never-ending struggle for black justice and equality in America. What bothers many middle-class whites in America is to constantly be blamed for all of the problems of American blacks, a large proportion of whom consistently behave in ways that are less healthy, less smart, and are often illegal. To convince white America that blacks have their own interests at heart, blacks need to stop doing so many felonious criminal activities, stop killing each other in disproportionately high numbers, stop looking for above-the-law treatment, and stop looking for entitlement rewards merely for being black. Many American whites have simply lost patience with entrenched bad behaviors by so many blacks as well as with their attitude that blacks be considered in a special category of Americans. These NY Times editorial board editorials only confirms and promote these exceptional expectations for the black population, and won't fly with many in America, who want to see more blacks helping themselves out with smart behaviors.

It appears, greatnfi, that you're trying to change the subject, like everyone who says "Most black murder victims are killed by other blacks.".  And the point is ... what?  It's also true that most white murder victims are killed by other whites.  Since murders are very often committed by relatives, co-workers, friends, and neighbors of the victims, it follows that killer and victim are of the same race.

No, it really doesn't suggest that. Please educate yourself. It is very clearly an outcry against the devaluing of black lives; it makes no comment on the value of other lives. If you can't hear the implicit "TOO" then you're hearing it wrong.

Once again, no such thing as "black-on-black" crime. It's just crime.

Bravo NYT editorial board! This strident defence of BLM is overdue from your pages. To object to the movement's insistence that specifically black lives matter  is to disregard the historical and continuing mistreatment that blacks have faced. It is the duty of the beneficiaries of white privilege to uncategorically state that the over aggressive policing of black people is intolerable.
Thank you for one of the most balanced, humane and understanding responses I've yet seen -- i wish there were more Christians like yourself.
She refuses to allow the five of them who said they sign licenses the authority to do so.
